headline: Why Micron (MU) is Poised to Beat Earnings Estimates Again
summary: Micron (MU) has an impressive earnings surprise history and currently possesses the right combination of the two key ingredients for a likely beat in its next quarterly report.

headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Stocks Drop on Export Curbs. What It Means for U.S. Chip Companies.
summary: SK Hynix and Samsung stocks dropped after U.S. Commerce Department said it would change the licensing system to obtain U.S. equipment for their Chinese plants.

raw.headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Stocks Drop on Export Curbs. What It Means for U.S. Chip Companies.
raw.summary: SK Hynix and Samsung stocks dropped after U.S. Commerce Department said it would change the licensing system to obtain U.S. equipment for their Chinese plants.

headline: If You Invested $1000 in Micron a Decade Ago, This is How Much It'd Be Worth Now
summary: Investing in certain stocks can pay off in the long run, especially if you hold on for a decade or more.

headline: Micron Technology (MU): Assessing the Stock’s Valuation as Investor Interest Builds
summary: Micron Technology (MU) has moved back into the spotlight this week, catching the attention of investors looking for signals in tech stocks, despite no headline-making event or AI innovation being revealed. Sometimes, trades like this are driven as much by shifting market sentiment as by company news, and the absence of a big announcement gives us a chance to focus on fundamentals. It is these quieter moments that often prompt the most meaningful questions for those weighing their next move on...

headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Sag After US Revokes China Chip Permits
summary: While both Korean companies have memory plants in Korea, China accounts for a major slice of their global output.  Samsung sank more than 2%, while SK Hynix stock was more than 4% lower in morning trading.

raw.headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Sag After US Revokes China Chip Permits
raw.summary: While both Korean companies have memory plants in Korea, China accounts for a major slice of their global output.  Samsung sank more than 2%, while SK Hynix stock was more than 4% lower in morning trading.
